comments:
When using eclipse 3.1 on a project where I use the java 1.5 syntax, i
encountered a very annoying problem with the content assist: it crashes each
time I call it and produces an exception (nullPointerException).

If i close the project and try the content assist on another project, it works
fine.  It seems that the content assist crashes while "reading" my code in order
to be able to produce its assist window.

Note that there are no compilation error in the project.

the logFile outputs the following text:

also note that, even after cleaning the project, rebuilding, shutting the
computer down,... the problem stays the same BUT IS LIMITED TO a specific
project, where I use Java 1.5 syntax (generics,...).

Finally, note that I am also using Java 1.5 syntax for other projects but no
problem is found...

Moving to JDT/Core since the NPE happens in the compiler.

Jerome, can you provide any test case to reproduce the problem. May be the
project you see the problem in if it isn't to big.

Look like a dup of bug 103994.
Please try a 3.1 maintenance build to see if your problem is fixed.

Closing as duplicate of bug 103994.
Please reopen if you get it again with an 3.1 maintenance build.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 103994 ***

tried maintenance build from 2005/08/11 and system works fine.
Thanks
